properties.question: Which of the following best describes the typical onset and resolution timeframe of a microcrystalline arthropathy attack?
properties.option_a: Gradual onset over several weeks, with complete resolution after a month.
properties.option_b: Abrupt onset within 24 hours, with symptoms spontaneously resolving in 7-10 days.
properties.option_c: Slow onset over a few months, with partial resolution after several weeks.
properties.option_d: Immediate onset, with symptoms persisting for more than a month.
